<a id="class_ResourceUID"></a>

# ResourceUID

**Inherits:** [Object](class_object.md)

A singleton that manages the unique identifiers of all resources within a project.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Resource UIDs (Unique IDentifiers) allow the engine to keep references between resources intact, even if files are renamed or moved. They can be accessed with ``uid://``.

\ **ResourceUID** keeps track of all registered resource UIDs in a project, generates new UIDs, and converts between their string and integer representations.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constants

<a id="class_ResourceUID_constant_INVALID_ID"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**INVALID_ID** = `-1` [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_constant_INVALID_ID)

The value to use for an invalid UID, for example if the resource could not be loaded.

Its text representation is ``uid://<invalid>``.

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_add_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_id**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md), path\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_add_id)

Adds a new UID value which is mapped to the given resource path.

Fails with an error if the UID already exists, so be sure to check [has_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_has_id) beforehand, or use [set_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_set_id) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_create_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **create_id**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_create_id)

Generates a random resource UID which is guaranteed to be unique within the list of currently loaded UIDs.

In order for this UID to be registered, you must call [add_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_add_id) or [set_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_set_id).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_create_id_for_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **create_id_for_path**\ (\ path\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_create_id_for_path)

Like [create_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_create_id), but the UID is seeded with the provided `path` and project name. UIDs generated for that path will be always the same within the current project.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_ensure_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **ensure_path**\ (\ path_or_uid\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_ensure_path)

Returns a path, converting `path_or_uid` if necessary. Prints an error if provided an invalid UID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_get_id_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **get_id_path**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_get_id_path)

Returns the path that the given UID value refers to.

Fails with an error if the UID does not exist, so be sure to check [has_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_has_id) beforehand.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_has_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **has_id**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_has_id)

Returns whether the given UID value is known to the cache.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_id_to_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **id_to_text**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_id_to_text)

Converts the given UID to a ``uid://`` string value.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_path_to_uid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **path_to_uid**\ (\ path\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_path_to_uid)

Converts the provided resource `path` to a UID. Returns the unchanged path if it has no associated UID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_remove_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **remove_id**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_remove_id)

Removes a loaded UID value from the cache.

Fails with an error if the UID does not exist, so be sure to check [has_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_has_id) beforehand.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_set_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_id**\ (\ id\: [int](class_int.md), path\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_set_id)

Updates the resource path of an existing UID.

Fails with an error if the UID does not exist, so be sure to check [has_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_has_id) beforehand, or use [add_id()](class_resourceuid.md#class_ResourceUID_method_add_id) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_text_to_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **text_to_id**\ (\ text_id\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_text_to_id)

Extracts the UID value from the given ``uid://`` string.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_ResourceUID_method_uid_to_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **uid_to_path**\ (\ uid\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_ResourceUID_method_uid_to_path)

Converts the provided `uid` to a path. Prints an error if the UID is invalid.
